message.content: One of the most significant events that happened in Canada in the past 20 years is the legalization of recreational cannabis. On October 17, 2018, Canada became the second country in the world, after Uruguay, to legalize the recreational use of marijuana nationwide. This event had a significant impact on Canadian society, economy, and legal framework. It brought about changes in drug policy, created a new industry, and sparked debates on various social, health, and legal issues. The legalization of cannabis in Canada has also influenced discussions and policies regarding drug reform in other countries.
